<u>Diphydæ</u>
Fig. 38. Vertical section of a Monogastric Diphyes -
39. Attached ovarium   a. Natatorial organ. b. ovisæ
39.a. Youngest stage of ovarium. a simple process of the common cavity - b.c. ovaria further advanced.
40. Prehensile organ - a.b. early stages -
41. Free swimming ovarium. a. natatorial organ. b. ovisae
42. Free swimming ovarium of Coryne (from Steenstrup) to
compare with fig. 41.
<u>Sertularidæ</u>
Fig. 43. Cell of Plumularia -- ? - a. peculiar clavate
organs - b. large thread cells.
44. cell of another Plumularia - letters as before
45. ovarium of Fig. 43.    a. organ containing thread cells similar to (f. 43a)  b. ova
46. Section of Plumularia
47. Section of Polygastric Diphyes
48. Section of Rhizostoma
49. Section of Monotome Medusa
*** In all the sectional diagrams the letters have the same meaning viz. 
m. Stomach. n. common cavity. o. canals. p. generative organ. 
q. nataorial organ. t. tentacle. u. margl vesicle. 
x.outer membrane x'. bract. x''. valvular membrane
